purpleculture_pinyin:
shāo
to burn; to cook; to stew; to bake; to roast; to heat; to boil (tea, water etc); fever; to run a temperature; (coll.) to let things go to one's head
сжечь; готовить; тушить; печь; жарить; согревать; кипятить (чай, вода и т. д.); высокая температура; запустить температуру; (кол.) позволить вещам взбрыкнуть

heisig_chinese_memo: King Yao loves everything to be fire hot including spicy food.  He even enjoys the heat from getting a fever!
Ru_trainchinese:
shāo: (глаг/сущ/прил) жечь, зажигать; греть, нагревать; переудобрять, вносить много удобрений; лихорадить, температурить; жар; (разг.) высокомерный, спесивый
shāo: (глаг) (способ приготовления пищи) тушить после жарки или жарить после тушения; обжаривать (одинак. с 烤)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A javelin thrower gets fired up from losing a competition and gets a fever from emotional anxiety.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " fire " and " Yao ", the original meaning is to make things catch fire. "Shuowen": "Yaoye. From the fire, Yaosheng." "Warring States Policy‧Qi Ce Si": "The officials steal the emperor's life and give the people the blame, and the people are called long live for burning their coupons."

" Burn " can mean irradiation. Tang Wangjian "Jiangling is the case": "There are many red medicines in the temple that burn people's eyes, and the moss on the ground feet stains horseshoes."

" Burn " also means that heating changes the object. Tang Hanyu's Epitaph of Li Jun, Doctor of Taixue: "When meeting the alchemist Liu Mi, from the method of receiving medicine... the method is to fill a pot with money, press the middle to be empty, and actually use mercury, cover the four sides, and burn it as Dansha cloud."

" Burn " Ye also said that the first oil, plus soup fried or stewed; or first and then cooked cooking oil Ye's. One of Song Su Shi's "Xincheng Daozhong": "Xi'an people should be the most happy, boil celery and burn bamboo shoots for spring ploughing."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " fire " and " Yao ", the original meaning is to make things catch fire.
humanum_full_description:
從「火」，「堯」聲，本義為使物著火。《說文》：「爇也。从火，堯聲。」《戰國策‧齊策四》：「臣竊矯君命，以責賜諸民，因燒其券，民稱萬歲。」

　　「燒」可表示照射。唐王建〈江陵即事〉：「寺多紅藥燒人眼，地足青苔染馬蹄。」

　　「燒」也表示加熱使物體發生變化。唐韓愈〈故太學博士李君墓志銘〉：「遇方士柳泌，從受藥法……其法以鈆滿一鼎，按中為空，實以水銀，蓋封四際，燒為丹沙云。」

　　「燒」亦表示先用油煠，再加湯汁炒或炖；或先煮熟再用油煠的烹飪方法。宋蘇軾〈新城道中〉之一：「西崦人家應最樂，煮芹燒筍餉春耕。」
humanum_short_description: 從「火」，「堯」聲，本義為使物著火。

燒燒RS
烧烧 		焼 burn, bake, heat, roast
  • emperor 堯/尧/尭 enjoying fire 火
  • fire 火 in a barbecue 堯/尧/尭
(Simplified: 烧)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 火 (fire) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 火 [ huǒ ] fire, flame; to burn; anger, rage
    • 堯 [ yáo ] a legendary ancient emperor-sage
①使東西着火：焚燒。燃燒。燒灼。燒燬。
②用火或發熱的東西使物品受熱起變化：燒水。燒飯。燒磚。燒焊。燒藍。燒料。
③一種烹飪方法：燒茄子。燒雞。
④體溫增高：發燒。退燒。
⑤經烘烤製成的餅：燒餅。火燒。
⑥一種烈性白酒：燒酒。高粱燒。
⑦過多的肥料使植物枯萎、死亡。
⑧焚燃。
燒傷 [ shāo shāng ]: burn (injury)
(Simplified: 烧)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 火 (fire) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 3
Chinese: King Yao loves everything to be fire hot including spicy food. He even enjoys the heat from getting a fever!
Meaning: fever
Hanzi: 烧
Story: A javelin thrower gets fired up from losing a competition and gets a fever from emotional anxiety.
Kind: traditional

從「 火 」，「 堯 」聲，本義為使物著火。《說文》：「爇也。从火，堯聲。」《戰國策‧齊策四》：「臣竊矯君命，以責賜諸民，因燒其券，民稱萬歲。」 「 燒 」可表示照射。唐王建〈江陵即事〉：「寺多紅藥燒人眼，地足青苔染馬蹄。」 「 燒 」也表示加熱使物體發生變化。唐韓愈〈故太學博士李君墓志銘〉：「遇方士柳泌，從受藥法……其法以鈆滿一鼎，按中為空，實以水銀，蓋封四際，燒為丹沙云。」 「 燒 」亦表示先用油煠，再加湯汁炒或炖；或先煮熟再用油煠的烹飪方法。宋蘇軾〈新城道中〉之一：「西崦人家應最樂，煮芹燒筍餉春耕。」
From the sound of " fire" and " Yao", the original meaning is to make things catch fire. "Shuowen": "Yaoye. From the fire, Yaosheng." "Warring States Policy‧Qi Ce Si": "The officials steal the emperor's life and give the people the blame, and the people are called long live for burning their coupons." " Burn" can mean irradiation. Tang Wangjian "Jiangling is the case": "There are many red medicines in the temple that burn people's eyes, and the moss on the ground feet stains horseshoes." " Burn" also means that heating changes the object. Tang Hanyu's Epitaph of Li Jun, Doctor of Taixue: "When meeting the alchemist Liu Mi, from the method of receiving medicine... the method is to fill a pot with money, press the middle to be empty, and actually use mercury, cover the four sides, and burn it as Dansha cloud." " Burn" Ye also said that the first oil, plus soup fried or stewed; or first and then cooked cooking oil Ye's. One of Song Su Shi's "Xincheng Daozhong": "Xi'an people should be the most happy, boil celery and burn bamboo shoots for spring ploughing."

燒字的基本解释

燒
shāo
见“烧”。

燒字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shāo］
［《廣韻》式招切，平宵，書。］
“烧1”的繁体字。
(1)焚烧；燃烧。
(2)燃点；燃放。
(3)烫；灼。
(4)烘烤；曝晒。
(5)照耀；映照。
(6)加热使物体发生变化。
(7)犹酿造。
(8)指烧酒。
(9)指强烈刺激。
(10)指激发。
(11)因病而体温升高。
(12)指升高了的体温。
(13)方言。谓被钱财弄昏头脑而不能自制。
(14)方言。坑害，作弄。
(15)因肥料过浓或未经充分发酵使植物体枯萎或死亡。
(16)烹调方法之一。先用油煠，再加汤汁炒或炖；或先煮熟再用油煠。
(17)指用烤或炒的方法使熟。
[②]［shào］
［《廣韻》失照切，去笑，書。］
“烧2”的繁体字。
(1)放火烧野草以肥田。
(2)泛指野火。
(3)指彩霞。

燒字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　燒； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页683第08
【唐韻】式昭切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】尸招切，?音?。【說文】?也。【玉篇】燔也。【禮·月令】仲夏毋燒灰。【戰國策】以責賜諸，民因燒其券。　又燒當，羌名。【後漢·西羌傳】至硏十三世孫燒當立。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?失照切，音少。【廣韻】放火。【韻會】野火曰燒。

燒字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
燒字的起名意思

暂无。

burn
Basic explanation of words
burn
shāo
See "Burn".
burn
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [shāo]
["Guangyun" style moves and cuts, flat night, book. ]
"Burn 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Incineration; burning.
(2) Ignition point; set off.
(3) Hot; scorching.
(4) Baking; exposure.
(5) Shine; shine.
(6) Heating changes the object.
(7) Still brewing.
(8) Refers to shochu.
(9) Refers to strong stimulation.
(10) Refers to excitation.
(11) Body temperature rises due to illness.
(12) Refers to elevated body temperature.
(13) Dialects. Said to be confused by money and unable to control himself.
(14) Dialects. Entrap, play tricks.
(15) Plants wither or die due to over-concentration of fertilizers or insufficient fermentation.
(16) One of the cooking methods. Use oil stew first, then stir-fry or stew with soup; or cook it first and then use oil stew.
(17) Refers to the method of roasting or stir-frying to make it cooked.
[②]［shào］
["Guangyun" is ill-defined, laugh, book. ]
"Burn 2" in traditional characters.
(1) Set fire to weeds to enrich the fields.
(2) Refers to wildfire in general.
(3) Refers to Caixia.
burn
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Si Collection] [Fire Word Department] 　烧; Kangxi strokes: 16; Page number: page 683 08
[Tang Yun] Shi Zhaoqie [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] The corpse moves and cuts,? Yin?. [Said the text]? Also. [Jade articles] Burnt also. 【Rite·Month Order】No ashes will be burnt in midsummer. [Warring States Policy] To give all the blame, the people burn their coupons.　Shao Dang again, the name of Qiang. [Later Han·Xiqiang Biography] To the thirteenth generation, the grandson burned and stood.　[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun]? Lost and cut, less sound. [Guang Yun] Set fire. [Rhyme Club] The wild fire says burn.
burn
